source.name: ERC-20 Use Cases
source.instructions:
Consider the following scenarios.
In which of them should ERC-20 tokens be used?
Select all that apply.

answers.answer: Creating a cryptocurrency for use within a decentralized application
Representing ownership of unique digital artwork
Implementing a loyalty points system where points can be divided and transferred
Tokenizing real estate properties, where each property is distinct
Creating tokens that can be easily swapped on decentralized exchanges

source.guidance: This question assesses the ability to apply knowledge of ERC-20 token standard to real-world scenarios. ERC-20 is suitable for scenarios requiring fungible, divisible tokens like cryptocurrencies, loyalty points, and tokens for easy exchange. ERC-721 is appropriate for unique, non-fungible assets like digital art and individual real estate properties. Understanding these distinctions is crucial for choosing the right token standard for specific use cases in blockchain development.
source.learningObjectives: SWBAT evaluate and distinguish appropriate use cases for ERC-20 token standards based on their properties
